result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James M. Radack

records.addlTxt: 3:45pm Defendant appeared in custody with Attorney George Miller. State by: Ellen Anderson, ADA Court makes oral ruling in favor of Defense. (recalled 4:32pm)   Defendant is advised of constitutional rights/Guilty Plea Form. Priors Acknowledged. Sentence recommendation by counsel. Court rules on sentence.

2:28 am Defendant James M. Radack in custody with Attorney George E. Miller.  Loralee Clark ADA for Ellen Anderson ADA appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has 218 days jail credit, issue if credit can apply to probation withheld sentence as its the minimum mandatory jail sentence.  State has reviewed 973.155 and 346.65 penalty section, has not seen anything that addresses the issue.  Court would need to research, if counsel could provide argument then the Court could make a decision.  Jury trial scheduled for April 5 and 6 this is the final status.  This is the #1 case.
Oral Ruling:  03-15-18 at 3:45 pm, counsel to have submissions in by end of business on Tuesday March 12.

Defendant James M. Radack in court with Attorney George E. Miller.  Defendant James M. Radack in custody.  Kelly Anne Mandelstein appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Not guilty plea entered.  This file is riding along with 15CF23, Branch 2 to schedule
